snippet: The sales figures suggest slowing consumer spending that could temper expectations of a strong gain in fourth-quarter growth.
abstract: Commerce Department reports retail sales rose 0.1 percent in October, but sales at auto dealers fell 0.5 percent, hurting overall results.
lead_paragraph: The sales figures suggest slowing consumer spending that could temper expectations of a strong gain in fourth-quarter growth.

headline.main: Auto Sales Dip, Hurting Overall Spending
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales Dip, Hurting Overall Spending
